byline.contributor: Alexandra Odynova contributed reporting from Grozny, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow.

abstract: Critics of Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin warn he has permitted Chechnya's leader Ramzan A Kadyrov to gain greater power as an unpredictable despot in region; Russian security services detest him because Putin allows him to act with impunity; Kadyrov is at center of mystery surrounding murder of opposition leader Boris Y Nemtsov.
lead_paragraph: Critics warn that President Vladimir V. Putin’s bargain to gain stability in Chechnya has unleashed an unpredictable despot in the region’s leader, Ramzan A. Kadyrov.

headline.main: Chechen’s Ties to Putin Are Questioned Amid Nemtsov Murder Case
headline.print_headline: In Murder Intrigue, a Chechen Strongman Fiercely Loyal to Putin

snippet: Critics warn that President Vladimir V. Putin’s bargain to gain stability in Chechnya has unleashed an unpredictable despot in the region’s leader, Ramzan A. Kadyrov.
